page.title: 08SANDFORD SCHOOL:BACKGROUND
page.content: Sandford School is a school for children with problems at home or school (for instance emotional or behaviour problems). It is probably the most difficult school to get into in Gloucestershire. The age range of the children taught is 6-17 years. There are ten classes with eight to ten pupils in each. There are 100 pupils in all with 15 teachers. The school is situated in 85 acres of land. Mr Morris the headmaster does not believe in a blackboard or teacher's desk. Instead they have small classes with group teachers. The social background for the children is the same as any other child would have in a comprehensive school. The subjects taught are the same as any other school's curriculum.
